summary: Trade agreements are a key component of the U.S. government's efforts to boost exports. The vast majority of U.S. exports are covered by at least one trade agreement, and several federal agencies work to monitor and enforce these agreements. These agencies estimated using more than 700 full-time equivalent staff, at a cost of more than $100 million, to carry out these responsibilities in fiscal year...
title: Trade Enforcement: Information on U.S. Agencies' Monitoring and Enforcement Resources for International Trade Agreements
